name: automationName
description: Which automation engine to use

name: platformName
description: Which mobile OS platform to use

name: platformVersion
description: Mobile OS version

name: deviceName
description: The kind of mobile device or emulator to use
help: iPhone Simulator, iPad Simulator, iPhone Retina 4-inch, Android Emulator, Galaxy  S4, etc…. On iOS, this should be one of the valid devices returned by  instruments with instruments -s devices. On Android this capability is  currently ignored.

name: app
description: The absolute local path *or* remote http URL to an .ipa or .apk file, or a  .zip containing one of these. Appium will attempt to install this app  binary on the appropriate device first. Note that this capability is not  required for Android if you specify appPackage and appActivity capabilities  (see below). Incompatible with browserName.

name: browserName
description: Name of mobile web browser to automate. Should be an empty string if  automating an app instead.
help: ‘Safari’ for iOS and ‘Chrome’, ‘Chromium’, or ‘Browser’ for Android

name: newCommandTimeout
description: How long (in seconds) Appium will wait for a new command from the client  before assuming the client quit and ending the session

name: autoLaunch
description: Whether to have Appium install and launch the app automatically. Default  true

name: language
description: (Sim/Emu-only) Language to set for the simulator / emulator

name: locale
description: (Sim/Emu-only) Locale to set for the simulator / emulator

name: udid
description: Unique device identifier of the connected physical device

name: orientation
description: (Sim/Emu-only) start in a certain orientation

name: autoWebview
description: Move directly into Webview context. Default false

name: noReset
description: Don’t reset app state before this session. Default false

name: fullReset
description: (iOS) Delete the entire simulator folder. (Android) Reset app state by  uninstalling app instead of clearing app data. On Android, this will also  remove the app after the session is complete. Default false

name: appActivity
description: Activity name for the Android activity you want to launch from your package

name: appPackage
description: Java package of the Android app you want to run

name: appWaitActivity
description: Activity name for the Android activity you want to wait for

name: appWaitPackage
description: Java package of the Android app you want to wait for

name: deviceReadyTimeout
description: Timeout in seconds while waiting for device to become ready

name: androidCoverage
description: Fully qualified instrumentation class. Passed to -w in adb shell am  instrument -e coverage true -w

name: enablePerformanceLogging
description: (Chrome and webview only) Enable Chromedriver’s performance logging  (default false)

name: androidDeviceReadyTimeout
description: Timeout in seconds used to wait for a device to become ready after booting

name: androidDeviceSocket
description: Devtools socket name. Needed only when tested app is a Chromium embedding  browser. The socket is open by the browser and Chromedriver connects to it  as a devtools client.

name: avd
description: Name of avd to launch

name: avdLaunchTimeout
description: How long to wait in milliseconds for an avd to launch and connect to ADB  (default 120000)

name: avdReadyTimeout
description: How long to wait in milliseconds for an avd to finish its boot animations  (default 120000)

name: avdArgs
description: Additional emulator arguments used when launching an avd

name: useKeystore
description: Use a custom keystore to sign apks, default false

name: keystorePath
description: Path to custom keystore, default ~/.android/debug.keystore

name: keystorePassword
description: Password for custom keystore

name: keyAlias
description: Alias for key

name: keyPassword
description: Password for key

name: chromedriverExecutable
description: The absolute local path to webdriver executable (if Chromium embedder  provides its own webdriver, it should be used instead of original  chromedriver bundled with Appium)

name: autoWebviewTimeout
description: Amount of time to wait for Webview context to become active, in ms.  Defaults to 2000

name: intentAction
description: Intent action which will be used to start activity (default  android.intent.action.MAIN)

name: intentCategory
description: Intent category which will be used to start activity (default  android.intent.category.LAUNCHER)

name: intentFlags
description: Flags that will be used to start activity (default 0x10200000)

name: optionalIntentArguments
description: Additional intent arguments that will be used to start activity. See Intent  arguments

name: unicodeKeyboard
description: Enable Unicode input, default false

name: resetKeyboard
description: Reset keyboard to its original state, after running Unicode tests with  unicodeKeyboard capability. Ignored if used alone. Default false

name: noSign
description: Skip checking and signing of app with debug keys, will work only with  UiAutomator and not with selendroid, default false

name: ignoreUnimportantViews
description: Calls the setCompressedLayoutHierarchy() uiautomator function. This  capability can speed up test execution, since Accessibility commands will  run faster ignoring some elements. The ignored elements will not be  findable, which is why this capability has also been implemented as a  toggle-able *setting* as well as a capability. Defaults to false
